reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights (mum and daughter) for a sight-seeing trip in Paris. The apartment reception was spotless and the staff very friendly and helpful. Reception is open 24 hours and all areas (doors and lifts) can only be accessed using a valid room key card, so also secure.
reviews.title: Great location and amenities, had everything we needed

reviews.text: There is a safe in the room (free of charge) and reception are able to stow your luggage securely after check out if you are not due to go to the station / airport until later (also free of charge). Wi-Fi is free and we had excellent reception in our room and the lobby area. The password does change every couple of days or so though, so you do need to ask for the new one at reception once it runs out.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment which had 2 single beds and a separate sofa bed. The apartment was spacious enough for a few nights and well stocked with hair dryer, iron ironing board, hoover, kitchen appliances (inc. dishwasher), utensils and spare towels and spare bed linen. The toilet and shower/ bathroom are separate which is useful. The shower was of a good power and all area of the apartment clean and well maintained. There is a table and chairs for eating / office work and a nice balcony area for some fresh air. Rooms have individually controlled central heating.
reviews.title: Great base with teenage kids

reviews.text: There is a little noise from the school kids in the street outside in the evening, but it was quiet enough at night.
reviews.title: Nice Aparthotel

reviews.text: There are plenty of restaurants, cafes and bars nearby serving a variety of cuisines at a reasonable price and a supermarket at the end of the road for those self catering. We mainly used the closer Botzaris Metro stop and also Belleville on some occasions. Jaure is closed for 2 of the metro lines until November 2013 I believe.
